data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE000_Description
data.value: Use this error code to search the Microsoft documentation for information on how to fix this issue.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE001
data.value: The {0} property is set to an invalid value

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE001_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid, locate the property, and set it to a valid value.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE002
data.value: The control is outside the right page margin

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE002_Description
data.value: Ensure that the control is inside the report's margins to avoid printing extra pages.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE003
data.value: The control is out of the report's printing area

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE003_Description
data.value: The control is outside the report printing area and will not be properly printed and/or exported.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE004
data.value: The control is overlapped

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE004_Description
data.value: Ensure that report controls do not overlap each other. Overlapped controls may be exported incorrectly to HTML, RTF, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, CSV, and Text formats.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE009
data.value: An error occurred when the {0} script method was executed

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE009_Description
data.value: The code in your scripts should handle all possible exception situations.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE010
data.value: Unable to resolve the '{0}' Navigation URL for the '_self' Target

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE010_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid, expand the Navigation URL property's drop-down list, and select a valid value.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE011
data.value: Unable to load the content from the specified {0}: '{1}'

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE011_Description
data.value: Ensure that the specified location is valid and accessible.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE012
data.value: Unable to resolve the uri from the specified {0}: '{1}'

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE012_Description
data.value: Ensure that the specified location is valid.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE013
data.value: Unable to load the content from the specified {0}: '{1}'

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE013_Description
data.value: To manage content loading settings, use the DevExpress.Security.Resources.AccessSettings.StaticResources property.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE015
data.value: The '{0}' text format string is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE015_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid, and click the Text Format String property's ellipsis button. Specify a valid format string in the invoked Format String Editor.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE016
data.value: The '{0}' formatting rule is not contained in the report's FormattingRuleSheet and will not be applied

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE016_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid, and click the Formatting Rules property's ellipsis button. Add the formatting rule in the invoked Formatting Rules Editor and apply the added rule to the control.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE020
data.value: The {0} property's binding does not match the data table

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE020_Description
data.value: Switch to the Property Grid and bind the property to a data field from the table to which the band is bound.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE021
data.value: The {0} property's expression does not match the data table

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE021_Description
data.value: Switch to the Property Grid, invoke the property's Expression Editor, and specify an expression that uses data fields from the table to which the band is bound.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE022
data.value: The {0} property's binding is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE022_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid's Data tab, expand the Data Bindings node and the {0} sub-node, and select a valid value for the Binding property.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE023
data.value: The {0} property's expression is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE023_Description
data.value: Ensure that data fields used in your expression exist in the data source. If the data fields do exist, make sure that your reports's DataSource and/or DataMember properties are specified.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE024
data.value: The data member is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE024_Description
data.value: Select the source, switch to the Properties window, and specify a data member for the data source.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE025
data.value: The data source is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE025_Description
data.value: An object assigned to the DataSource property cannot be used as a report's datasource, because it does not implement any of supported interfaces.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE026
data.value: The filter string is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE026_Description
data.value: Switch to the Property Grid and specify a valid Text Filter String property value.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE027
data.value: The calculated field's expression is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE027_Description
data.value: Select the calculated field, switch to the Properties window, and specify a valid value for the Expression property. You can click the Expression property's ellipsis button and construct an expression in the invoked Expression Editor.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE028
data.value: Can not identify the calculated field's data source

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE028_Description
data.value: Select the calculated field, switch to the Properties window, and specify a Data Source. If the calculated field is not needed, delete this field: select the report, switch to the Properties window, and click the Calculated Fields property's ellipsis button.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE030
data.value: The detail report band has an inappropriate detail level

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE030_Description
data.value: Bind the Detail Report Bands to sequential levels of nesting in the data source. Ensure that all intermediate nested levels are displayed.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE040
data.value: The End Band is not complementary to the Start Band.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE040_Description
data.value: Ensure that the control starts and ends in bands that appear in the report an equal number of times.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE050
data.value: The barcode text contains invalid characters

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE050_Description
data.value: Ensure that all characters meet the barcode specification. If your barcode uses static text, select the barcode, expand the smart tag, and correct the Text property value. If the barcode uses an expression, ensure that the expression fetches only valid characters.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE051
data.value: The barcode text format is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE051_Description
data.value: Ensure that the barcode text format meets the barcode specification. If your barcode uses static text, select the barcode, expand the smart tag, and correct the Text property value. If the barcode uses an expression, ensure that the expression fetches correct values.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE052
data.value: The barcode data is not valid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE052_Description
data.value: Ensure that the binary data assigned to the bar code is not longer than 1033 bytes and meets requirements for the current symbology.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE053
data.value: The barcode bounds are too small

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE053_Description
data.value: Select the barcode, switch to the Property Grid, and increase the Width and Height properties.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE054
data.value: The barcode has incompatible settings

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE054_Description
data.value: Ensure that the barcode settings meet the barcode specification.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE060
data.value: The referenced report contains a page header or a page footer band

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE060_Description
data.value: Referenced reports cannot contain a page header or page footer band. Remove these bands from the referenced report or reference a report that does not contain a page header or page footer band.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE061
data.value: The referenced report's page width exceeds the current one

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE061_Description
data.value: The referenced report's page width should be smaller than the main report's page width. Select the report, switch to the Property Grid, and change the Paper Kind property value.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE062
data.value: The parameter name in the {0} binding is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE062_Description
data.value: Expand the Subreport control's smart tag and click Edit Parameter Bindings. In the invoked Parameter Binding Collection Editor, select a valid parameter.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE063
data.value: The {1} type does not match the report parameter type in the {0} binding

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE063_Description
data.value: Ensure that the referenced report's parameter is of the same type as the main report's parameter. Expand the Subreport control's smart tag and click Edit Parameter Bindings. In the invoked Parameter Binding Collection Editor, select a parameter of the appropriate type.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE064
data.value: Unable to assign the '{1}' value to the report parameter in the {0} binding

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE064_Description
data.value: Ensure that the value type is appropriate for the report parameter.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE070
data.value: The line's width exceeds its bounds

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE070_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Property Grid, and set a smaller Line Width or a greater Size.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE080
data.value: The cross tab field is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE080_Description
data.value: Expand the report's smart tag and click Edit Bindings. In the invoked Edit Bindings dialog, check that all cross tab fields are bound to valid data fields.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE081
data.value: The {0} parameter's binding is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE081_Description
data.value: Expand the Cross Tab control's smart tag and click the Parameters property's ellipsis button. In the invoked Collection Editor, specify a valid binding for the Cross Tab's parameter.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE090
data.value: No region is specified for the summary

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE090_Description
data.value: Select the control that displays the summary, expand the smart tag, and select a region from the drop-down Summary box.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE091
data.value: No group fields are specified for the group summary

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE091_Description
data.value: Select the control that displays the summary, expand the smart tag, and specify a group field in the drop-down Data Binding box.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE092
data.value: The Detail band does not display data to use for the page summary

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE092_Description
data.value: Ensure the Detail band displays data. Add controls to the Detail band and bind these controls to data source fields.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE093
data.value: Summary Running for the control is set to the '{0}' value, but its expression has no summary functions.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE093_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Properties window, and add a summary function (for instance, sumSum) to the Text property's expression, or set Summary Running to None.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE100
data.value: The {0} query's {1} parameter binding is invalid

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE100_Description
data.value: Ensure that the query parameter's binding is valid. Right-click the data source in the Field List and select Manage Queries. In the invoked Manage Queries dialog, click the query's ellipsis button, and then click Run Query Builder in the Query Editor. Click Edit Parameters in the Query Builder dialog and specify a valid value for the query parameter.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE101
data.value: The {1} query parameter type does not match the report parameter in the {0} query

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE101_Description
data.value: Ensure you bind the query parameter to data of the appropriate type. Right-click the data source in the Field List and select Manage Queries. In the invoked Manage Queries dialog, click the query's ellipsis button, and then click Run Query Builder in the Query Editor. Click Edit Parameters in the Query Builder dialog and specify a valid value for the query parameter.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE110
data.value: The PageRange property value '{0}' cannot be converted to page numbers

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE110_Description
data.value: Select the control, switch to the Properties window, and set the PageRange property to a valid value.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE230
data.value: Some elements of your document overlap and thus can be exported to {0} format incorrectly.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE230_Description
data.value: If possible, modify your report layout such that the report document does not contain overlapped elements.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE270
data.value: Some elements of your document span across several pages and thus cannot be exported to {0} format correctly with the specified export settings.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE270_Description
data.value: If possible, try to use 'Single File' export mode when you export your document to RTF, DOCX, XLS, or XLSX format.

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE900
data.value: The Report Design Analyzer has crashed

data.name: ErrorStringId.XRE900_Description
data.value: Ask for help from your application maintainer.
